doc.after: For example the graphs shown to the right show the error in approximating log(x) and exp(x) for NÂ =Â 4. The red curves, for the optimal polynomial, are level, that is, they oscillate between and exactly. Note that, in each case, the number of extrema is N+2, that is, 6. Two of the extrema are at the end points of the interval, at the left and right edges of the graphs.
